ribbondesc: Advancing the frontiers of computational multiphysics through innovative research and cutting-edge numerical methods.

projects.title: Integrating Multiscale Modeling and Experiments to Develop a Meso-Informed Predictive Capability for Explosives Safety and Performance
projects.source: U.S. Department of Defense, Air Force Office of Scientific Research (AFOSR), MURI Program
contributions: Higher Order Accurate Modeling of Micro/Meso/Macro scale simulations
New Framework to model Flyer Impact induced Shock Initiation of PBX
Physics Aware Recurrent Convolutional Neural Network
New sub-grid scale closure models (PARC & MISSEL) for Macro-Scale Sensitivity Predictions
projects.notes: 4 papers published; 1 in Science Advances (IF=13.6), 5+ in progress

projects.title: Development of a Multiscale Computational Framework for High Speed Multimaterial Dynamics
projects.source: U.S. Department of Defense, AFRL Munitions Directorate (AFRL/RWML)
contributions: Uncertainty Quantification of Surrogate Burn Model MESIG
Published two-part paper in Journal of Applied Physics
Extending burn model to multi-dimensional prediction of corner turning and re-detonation

projects.title: Physics-Informed Meta-Learning for Design of Complex Materials
contributions: Deep learning model to meta-learn thermo-mechanical response of CHNO explosives
Building material database of HMX, RDX, TNT, PETN, TATB
Running mesoscale simulations and training PhD students

Past Research.title: Autonomous Vehicle Research
Past Research.subtitle: Navigation, sensing, and control systems
Past Research.overview: Graduate researchers work on sensors, control algorithms, and real-time processing for AVs.

Graduate Student Researcher.title: Smart Irrigation Systems
Graduate Student Researcher.subtitle: IoT-based water management
Graduate Student Researcher.overview: Undergraduates contribute to IoT-based irrigation using sensors, control valves, and mobile dashboards.

about.title: Computational Multiphysics Research Lab
about.description: Advancing the frontiers of computational science through innovative multiphysics simulations and numerical methods. We develop cutting-edge algorithms for complex engineering and scientific applications.
